Line: I have never seen an old person in a new bathing suit in my life. I don't know where they get their bathing suits, but my father has bathing suits from other centuries. My parents live in Florida, and if you go down there and you forget your bathing suits then they want you to wear one of theirs. You know how that gets? "You need trunks son? I've got trunks for you. You can wear my trunks." Fathers don't wear bathing suits, they wear trunks. It's kind of the same thing a tree would wear if it went swimming. So I get in the water with in thing and it's like floating around me somewhere. Did you ever put on a bathing suit that you don't even know exactly where you are inside the bathing suit? You bump into somebody you know: "No I'm parasailing, I'm waiting for the boat to come back."
They were supposed to be here at 7:30. Call the airlines again.
What happened to the scotch tape? Who takes the scotch tape? Nobody returns anything around here.
You what I'll do next time? I'll hide it so nobody can find it.
So, what took you so long?
We waited 35 minutes in the rent-a-car place.
I don't know why you had to rent a car. We would have picked you up.
You could have used our car.
I don't wanna use your car.
Nothing. It's a fine car. What if you wanna use it?
What are you talking? We use it.
If you were using it, we wouldn't use it.
So what would you do? You'd hitch?
I don't know. 25 bucks a day.
Oh, I didn't get the insurance.
How could you not get the insurance?
God it's so hot in here. Why don't you put on the air conditioning?
You don't need the air conditioner. So, you have your speech all ready?
It's not a speech. Do I have to make a speech?
Of course, they're giving a testimonial for your father. You could do your comic routines.
Oh yeah, that will go over real well with that crowd.
Are you kidding? They built the lake.
Where are you going with those?
I'm gonna put Elaine's stuff in here.
Don't sleep in there. You can you use the bedroom.
I'm up at 6 o'clock in the morning.
I can't kick you out of your bed.
But this is sofa bed, you'll be uncomfortable.
I'll sleep standing up. I'll be fine.
Yeah, I'll just stay in here.
Jerry. You don't have to stay on the couch on my account. The two of you could stay in there together.
No that's not such a good idea.
I don't know. We decided we don't really work as a couple.

...but you know, look at the sun-dried tomatoes. Where were they five years ago? It just goes to show you. You never know what... huh you know... huh... What could happen to a vegetable. It could just take right off at any time. We've tried all kind of arrangments, but we can't seem to be friend when we sleep together.
Why do you need more friends? You've got plenty of friends.
What the hell are you looking for?
I'm looking. That's the point. I like looking.
But how long can you look?
You know your father wouldn't say so but he's really glad you came.
This is a big thing for him. Outgoing president of the condo association.
Nice to meet you. This is Elaine.
So Jerry, you came all the way down here for this?
Scuba diving? Who's going scuba diving?
We're going scuba diving. We'll be back in time.
What do you have to go scuba diving for?
Jack is emceeing tomorrow. He's in charge of the whole thing.
So Jerry, your mother told me you're gonna do one your little comedy skit tommsorow?
No? Listen Morty you wanna settle up for last night? All right. I owe you 19.45$ .
What did you have? You had the minute steak?
Did you have a coke or what?
I did NOT have a coke.
So that's 17.10$ and the tax and the tip.
See? You know your father. He can't get a write to the penny, but that's why he was such a good president.
What kind of pen is that?
This is an astronaut pen. It writes upside down. They use this in space.
Wow! That's the astronaut pen. I heard about that. Where did you get it?
Cause sometimes I write in bed and I have to turn and lean on my elbow to make the pen works.
Jack, we should go. It was nice to meeting you.
What did you take his pen for?
What he gave it to me.
You didn't have to take it.
Oh my God! She's gotta make a big deal out of everything.
Because you made such a big fuss about it.
I liked it. Should I have said I didn't like it?
You shouldn't have said anything. What did you expect him to do?
He could have said: "Thank you, I like it too" and put it back in his pocket.
He talks about it all the time. Every time he takes it out he goes on and on about how it writes upside down, how the astronauts use it.
If he likes it so much, he never should have offered it.
I know his wife. She has some mouth on her. She'll tell everyone in the condo now that you made him give you the pen. They're talking about it right now.
So you want me to return it?
He's not gonna return the pen. That's ridiculous.
Hey I don't even want the pen now!
Jack can afford to give away a pen with all his money. Believe me. He gives me a check for 19.45. He didn't have a Coke. Ho, ho, ho!
Here, let me see it. Hey, it wrtites upside down.
Why is it so hot in here? How can they sleep like this?
It's only for three days. Today's over and we have tommorow. We leave on Sunday. It's one day, really.
Oh man. What is with this bar? It's right in my back. It's killing me.
Oh you wanna switch? I'm sleeping on a love seat. I've got my feet up in the air like I'm in a space capsule.
I am never gonna fall asleep.
Oh, don't say that. You'll jinx me.
How can they not put the air conditioning on?
This bar is right in my back! It's making a dent.
How about that guy writing a check for
I'm sweating here. I'm in bed, sweating.
It's one day. Half a day, really. I mean you substract showers and meals, it's like twenty minutes. It will go by like that.

Stay on 95 South to Biscayne Boulevard. Then you make a left turn. Put you blinker on immediatly, there's an abutment there. Then you're gonna merge over very quickly, but stay on Biscayne. Don't get off Biscayne. You understand me?
Yes. Generally that's where scuba diving is done.
What do you have to go underwater for? What's down there that's so special?
That... That bed. The bar was right in my back.
I told you to let us sleep in there.
Then YOU would be hunched over.
I don't even know if I can go scuba diving.
Without you? That's the whole reason you came down here.
Maybe you should see a doctor.
We'll stay in a hotel tonight.
Why don't you get a new sofa?
I'm buying you a new sofa.
Mrs Seinfeld, please. I am begging you. Put the air conditioner on.
I don't even know how to work it.
I keep telling her it's like an oven in here.
Oh stop worrying so much about how you look.
The pen. The one Jack Klompus gave you.
That's some good pen. It writes upside down.
I don't know. She said Jerry wanted the pen.
I never really wanted the pen.
Why you don't like the pen?
Cause if you don't like it, give it back to him.
Hello? Oh hello Gussy. What? Jerry wouldn't do that. Jack gave it to him. All he said was he liked it. I mean nobody put a gun to his head. You're giving him back that pen.
Oh! I forgot all about it.
All I said was "I like the pen".
How the hell do you work this thing?
Maybe a couple of muscle relaxers would help.
Oh, oh, O.K. You can turn down the air conditioning if you want.
Oh my God! What the hell happened to you?
Your capillaries? Do you know what you look like?
Is it my imagination or is it freezing in here?
Well I started to go under...
Yeah, and I got about ten feet down and I felt this tremendous pressure on my mask. Like my eyeballs were being sucked out of their sockets.
Excuse me. Doris would like to borrow red your pocketbook to go with her shoes. The shoes have to match the pocketbook. What's she doing? Yoga?
Morty you gotta hurry up. Get ready.
I got in a fist fight with one of the ladies at the pool.
Listen M. Klompus, it was really a nice gesture of you to give me the pen, but I don't really need it.
I mean it's a terrific pen, but I think you should keep it.
You know Jack, you've got a hell of a nerve taking that kid's pen.
This happens to be my pen.
You didn't give it to him.
What are you talking about? He pratically begged me for it.
Where do you come off with this crap?
Listen, do you think I take everything everybody offers me? You offered me sponge cake yesterday. Did I take it?
You said you didn't want it!
Of course I wanted it! I love sponge cake!
Then who the hell said you couldn't have any? I mean what the hell do I care whether you have sponge cake?
Because I saw the look on your face last week when I took the scotch tape!
Ahh! Ahh! So YOU got the scotch tape! I've been looking all over for it!
Don't worry about it! I'll give it back!
You know Jack, do me a favor will you? Take the pen and the scotch tape, and get the hell out of here!
Listen do you think I give a damn?
Aah! The nerve of that guy! Taking back that pen. Well that'it for them.
What is going on in this community! Are you people aware of what's happening? What is driving you to this behavior? Is it the humudity? Is it the Muzak? Is it the white shoes?
I have no use for either one of them. I don't even want them there tonight.
Isn't he supposed to be the emcee?
yeah, he's supposed to be the emcee.
Well. This should be a very interesting evening.
Uh... What about those muscle relaxers?
You took too many of those pills.
Good. O.K. What about last year when I took him to the hospital every day? Did he ever say thank you?
What's with the sunglasses? Who are you? Van Johnson?
Elaine, this is my aunt Stella.
Humm... We saw you on "The Tonight Show" last week.
I thought Johnny was very rude to you. He didn't even let you talk.
You need some new material. I've heard you do that dog routine three times already.
Listen, you should get your cousin Jeffrey to write some material for you.
What are you talking? Jeffrey works for the parks department!
You should read the letters he's written. He's funnier than the whole bunch of you! Oh, here's Jack. We should sit down.
This better be good. I'm missing "Golden Girls" for this.

Ladies and gentlemen, as you know, every year, Phase Two of the Pines of Mark Gables honors the previous year president. And this year we are honoring Morty Seinfeld A man who slept more hours on the job than Ronald Reagan.
Being president of the condo is not easy. It requires hard work, dedication, and commitment, and unfortunately he possesses none of these qualities.
His administration did excel in one department: the hiring of incompetents.
But we do owe him a debt of gratitude because by not fixing the crack in the sidewalk, he put Mrs Ziven out of commission for a few weeks.
Tell them when you took my son's pen back. Tell them about that!
He gave my son a pen, and then he takes it back. Tell them about that!
Come on. That's enough, sit down!
Ow! You broke my dental plate! Doris! He broke my dental plate. You son-of-a-bitch! I'm gonna sue you.
Oh God! huh... Hey! How you folks doing tonight?
Have you ever noticed how they always give you the peanuts on the planes?
Not my Harry. He flies first class.
Who ever thought the first thing somebody wants on a plane is a peanut?
I'd rather have a bottle of scotch!
All I said was I liked the pen!
You could aggravated. I wouldn't go anywhere for at least five days.
Five days? You want me to stay here for five more days?
So we have you for five more days!
Well there's really no point in me staying. I mean you just gonna be...
Has Morty decided on a lawyer yet?
Because my nephew Larry could do it. He's a brilliant lawyer. He says Jack has no case.
I'll ask him when he gets up.

Oh, and I spoke to Arnold. And he says that according to the bylaws of the condo constitution, they need six votes to throw you out for unruly behavior. Not five. Doctor Chernov is the one you'll have to suck up to.
Aw! Aw! Oh my back! Oh my back! It's that bar. Who the hell could sleep on that thing?
Morty, Arnold says they need six votes to throw you out.
Well today's almost over. And weekdays always go by fast. Friday we're leaving. It's like two days really. It's like a cup of coffee. It will go by like that.
